summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to a colleague, discussing potential statements from depositions (Boies and McCawley) related to Jeffrey Epstein's activities and strategizing about how to formulate an indictment. The email seeks to schedule a follow-up discussion.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who was 'particularly thinking of' specific deposition statements that are being reviewed for potential use in an indictment.

persons.name: Boies
persons.context: Subject of a deposition from which statements about never giving massages and not being aware of Epstein's sexual activities with others are being considered.

persons.name: McCawley
persons.context: Subject of a deposition from which statements about awareness of age and interactions are being considered.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced indirectly as the subject of the investigation, with discussions about his alleged sexual activities and a scheme to recruit underage girls.

connections.description: Boies gave a deposition containing statements about his awareness (or lack thereof) of Epstein's sexual activities.
McCawley gave a deposition containing statements about his interactions and awareness related to Epstein and underage individuals.
Geoff has conveyed thoughts to the AUSA, and they are collaborating on case strategy regarding deposition statements and indictment formulation.

events.title: Strategy Discussion
events.description: The AUSA and colleagues held a discussion about the case, providing thoughts and input on deposition statements and indictment strategy.

events.title: Boies Deposition
events.description: A deposition was taken from Boies, who made statements about not giving massages, not being aware of Epstein's sexual activities with others, and answers relating to sex toys.

events.title: McCawley Deposition
events.description: A deposition was taken from McCawley, who made statements about his awareness of age and interactions, and not knowing about Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are reviewing specific deposition statements from Boies and McCawley for potential use in a criminal indictment related to Jeffrey Epstein.

The statements under consideration include denials of giving massages, lack of awareness of Epstein's sexual activities with others, and questions about knowledge of a scheme to recruit underage girls.
The email indicates active strategy discussions among federal prosecutors about how to best formulate the indictment based on these witness statements.
The correspondence is dated May 29, 2020, showing ongoing investigative work after Epstein's death in August 2019.
